Love this place.  The chicken gyro is delicious!  My husband gets the regular.  We both get feta to make them supreme!  We've been coming here since 2002 - Sophocles is the best!  Rice pudding is a great treat!

I have been coming since the Gslleria Mall opened! The food is amazing and is truly authentic! The consistency is astounding. The customer service is top notch and I tell everyone I know that this where you go for a gyros. Love love love this place!

In keeping with my own self enforced tradition of ordering a sampler plate when trying a new place, I ordered the Greek Sampler plate from Kyklos today. The price was a bit much but there was a lot of food and a good variety. Lets break it down:  A Greek Sampler plate comes with gyro meat, chicken, rice, dolma, spanikopita, tikopita and tzaziki sauce. Thats a lot of food. I started with the gyro meat and tzaziki sauce. The sauce was great. Tangy. Dilly. Fresh. The meat was good too. A little dry and thickly sliced compared to what I am used to but great flavor. Then I moved on to the chicken. Well seasoned and mostly tender. Nothing exciting though. The tikopita, unknown to me before this outting, was impressive. Flaky, crispy, cheesy. I'd order that again. The dolma was served warm with a lemon sauce. And it was stuffed with meat and rice as opposed to just rice. That was a different take but no less delicious. Dolma is a favorite treat of mine. In multiple varieties. Next I cleaned off all the rice out of the platter. Rice is rice but but this was good. There was some sort of sauce on it that added a little something. Finally, the spanikopita. It was filled with spanikopious amounts of spinach, onion and cheese. An impressive and filling representation of a dish I've a few times elsewhere.  Whew, that was a mouth full. A few mouths full really. Who knew solid Greek food could come from the food court at the mall. The service was good and friendly though the lady taking my order kept trying to add on more food. Had I gone with all she had offered, my meal would have been over $20. I kept my order with the sampler as is and only added on a drink. That was more than enough. While I waited for everything to be prepped and served, I was watching the dynamic of the people working behind the scenes. I could tell that they were family. Its good to see that and you can taste it in the food. I've passed by this place too many times. No more. I'll have to come back to Kyklos and try some other goodies.

This place was pretty amazing. The owner (?) has great customer service, honestly, better than most full-fledged restuarants. The food was A+ so if you're ever at the food court, stop by. You definitely won't regret it.  I got a chicken gyro and mozzarella sticks (the marina sauce was AWESOME) and my husband got gyro fries. He's usually pretty stingy on giving compliments but he had nothing but praise for both the service and the food. Come check it out, seriously!
Pleasantly surprised by the quality for being mall food, friendly staff that really seem to care about what they're doing!

EXCELLENT!!!  We don't really get to the mall that often. When we do, it is only to go to the big box stores. We were hungry, and nothing sounded good. We were actually headed to another place when they enticed us with samples here at Kyklos. They had chicken right off of the grille. It was really flavorful.  Then we couldn't decide what entree to get. The guy ordering in front of us asked if we had ever been to this place, and then offered up about 3 selections that he gets. They all included the chicken. We decided to split a chicken gyro. I am not a fan of feta cheese, so we opted not to get that add-on.   They cooked ours to order. It came out loaded with chicken, thinly sliced onions, tomatoes and that wonderful tzatziki sauce. The pita was warm and soft. This was a very tasty meal. Very messy...so make sure and get lots of napkins. Also, their soda refills are 75 cents, if you need one.
The chicken salad with dressing is soooo good & the staff was super sweet too. I hardly ever eat mall food but this is next level.  :)

I never appreciated Greek food till place. Been coming here for years now. Sometimes me and my husband would drive here from Green Valley area just to have it for dinner.   One thing I don't like.... Is the price! I've always thought $10 is a little much. I have always ordered the same thing. Chicken Gyro Plate. I think I ordered just a regular style Gyro once and just enjoyed the plate much better.  I believe the owners used to work behind the counter and now they have hired people? If that's the case... Good for them!!! Although I do prefer the owners, if that was them in the past. Best personality, very friendly and welcoming.   I probably come here at least once a month. My only ONLY gripe..... SEEDS!!! I have not even completed my meal and have bitten down on 5 seeds already! Lemon seeds? I don't know? Can you guys please strain the juice so that customers don't bite down on seeds... I have to fish them out from my mouth while trying to enjoy my meal??? Please!!!   Aside from the seeds and the price... I'm happy! Thanks!!

Very impressive for Greek and "food court food!" This place takes passion in their product and it shows every time, never a time where it's lacking. It's a bummer when places try to pass as "Mediterranean" or "Greek" and they're not. Kyklos is the real deal! The dolmathes are amazing; meat-filled and with lemon sauce. They don't have the usual gummy rice filling that's so tart it makes you gag. They also come warm at Kyklos, a plus! Rice pudding is something I always get and its worth it. Warm, seasoned perfectly and great size for the price. The best is that you know you are getting fresh, quality, and pretty healthy food at Kyklos. A must when I come to galleria mall, in fact I'd eat here before any of the restaurants.

Not only is the food fantastic, the people are so friendly and helpful. I had my first Gyro with these guys and I go back for more every time I'm at galleria mall. For me its the best food there. The meat is so tender. Give them a try.

Num num num. Since moving to Vegas, Mall food has meant one of two things...pizza or Panda Express type places. Oh, that was not the case when we were holiday shopping and in need of some food. I go through times when I eat A LOT of Greek food. This time was at the tail end of one of those times, so I was a bit hesitant to try Greek food at the mall. Both my wife and I had the falafel gyro with hummus and pita. WOW...all the food was fantastic! The falafels where very well prepared, and had the perfect texture. The hummus tasted fresh, and the pita was some of the best I have ever had.  While we were waiting for our food, the owner chatted with us for a few minutes as well. This really capped off a great experience as he was willing to answer questions we have.  Great place to have a quality meal while shopping, particularly for those folks who may be vegetarian or have a hard time finding healthy food at the mall.
The staff are super kind and the food is amazing. Never had a bad experience there. I'm looooooving the gyro fries.
A little slow bit well worth the wait.  Had the chicken gyro amd humus for lunch.   It was so good I've been talking about it all day.
Always great food and customer service!!!! Guys here put in that werkkk!!!! Highly reccomend this place oddly enough it's located in the galleria mall
Beyond good!!! Authentic Greek food and quality service!  Clean and fresh! I highly recommend eating here!!!

Greek cafe located in the food court of the Galleria Mall.  The staff were very friendly and let me sample some of the chicken while I was overlooking the menu.  I had the grilled chicken gyro which was absolutely delicious. I will be back!

I was starving and this place was still disappointing. The gyro was not warm enough the meat was just salty,not flavorful.  The tabbouleh was $3.25 for a tiny cup that was mainly just filled with parsley. Possibly the most disappointing Greek food I've eaten. On top of it all the prices are pretty expensive even compared to mall prices. Nearly $12 for a small gyro and some tabbouleh? Maybe their prices could be more reasonable if they didn't hand out business cards with pointless quotes from ancient philosophers on them.  This place is pure garbage.

This location inside of the Galleria Mall is very convenient if you need a quick bite. The menu is large so it took some time for me to decide what I wanted to order.  The customer service was really good. Everyone working was friendly and they kept up a fast pace in getting all of the orders out to customers.   I had the Chicken Over Rice plus a Chicken Souvlaki skewer. The price was reasonable for the enormous amount of food. I was able to enjoy half for dinner and half for lunch the next day. The rice was great, well prepared with a little oil for flavor. The dish also came with plenty of vegetables. I'm also a fan when a restaurant includes vegetables and they had a good taste. The chicken that came with the dish was in small pieces with a nice flavor to them. The souvlaki pieces were larger pieces that were tender, but lacked flavor. The tomato sauce served with the dish was really good and I loved the flavor. The sauce definitely made the dish.

This is my update to Kyklos as I was contacted by the very, very nice manager in response to my disappointment I had with my Groupon and gyro experience.   I have once again returned to Kyklos and I will return again and again when I am shopping at The Galleria. It honestly is the best place to eat in the food court. They take great pride in their food here and the staff is incredibly friendly. This time I went I once again had a gyro and this time I got my feta on the side. I highly recommend this as it lets you sprinkle the exact amount of feta as you eat. I also got the rice, which I thought would be simple, yet it was bursting with delicious tomato flavor!  I must say Kyklos is kicking butt in the arena of mall food AND Greek food! Can't wait to try something else here.

To say this is my favorite spot I have ever had a gyro would be doing this plays a major disservice. I have been an obsessive customer for over six years, and their customer service has always been one that could go toe to toe with one of the nicest restaurants you've ever been to, The quality of their ingredients makes it near impossible to even enjoy a gyro anywhere else, and the portion size you could argue is the best bang for your buck he will ever find.   I promise you would be doing yourself a disservice not experiencing this for yourself.

Been coming to this place for years. I never thought I'd make a trip to the mall just for food. By far the best Greek food I've had in Vegas. The staff is always nice, warm, and welcoming. Nice to see a team time pride in their food.
Finally got to try this place as I love Gyros (at least most of them).  I must say this place passed my test.  the Gyro was outstanding!  Full of flavor, better than a lot of others I have tried.

I think I need to give this place another shot but not sure if I want to. After looking at everyone's pictures and reviews the food looks so good! That's definitely NOT what my Gyro looked like this morning...  I took my son to the mall this morning and we were both starving. Trying to steer clear of greasy pizza I wandered here thinking its been awhile since I've even had Greek food. The guy at the counter was really friendly, it took about 10 minutes to make but when I opened it, it was one big greasy, sauce ball. So much sauce and so soggy it was unenjoyable. The meat was seasoned well but everything else tasted old and...wet :(   For $9, I wasn't very satisfied. Maybe our next mall visit I'll try again and request for an easy on the sauce.

Stopped by this place today!  My first Greek restaurant I went to 12 years ago in Vegas and it's still as delicious as the first time!  I hate that I moved so far away, but if I'm ever in the area I stop in for a delicious treat!  Super friendly staff doesn't hurt either!

We just found a new spot. Great service from a family business. They greet you when you arrive in the area.  It makes you feel like family!!  I would never expect this kind of mouth watering food in a mall.   Try the Gyro Supreme, it is fantastic!!

Got the Dolmas for lunch to go.. Was not that hungry so figured a side of dolmas would be perfect. Opened the container at the office they were put together pretty sloopy, almost falling apart There was no taziki sauce or marinara sauce which I was expecting... I'm a sauce whore so this no sauce thing is kind of a deal breaker. I ate 2 and was over it. I have had way better dolmas and counld't stomach the other one. Pretty disappinted considering that the Gyros here are amazing.

I had lost all hope for meeting any friendly people in Henderson until I met Soph at Kyklos. Soph is so warm and personable, couldn't help but purchase from Soph. I had the chicken gyro. Wonderful. The meat is seasoned to perfection. There is enough food for leftovers. Love how Soph offers you a sample with such enthusiasm with every potential customer. I highly recommend eating here. The food is great and Soph is wonderful.
The food, owner and service is absolutly amazing!  If you like Greek food you can't go wrong at Kyklos Greek Cafe!

Ordered the leg of lamb plate. Rice was bland and kind of mushy. Came with barely any veggies. The meat was okay but I wouldn't order it again. Baklava  was NOT good. Tasted a lot  different than other baklava...

Ok, now when your in a mall you expect to spend a little more cause your in the mall and you expect ehh?, mall food. well here's the reason why I only gave Kyklos 3 stars, there is no denying the food is great, the Gyro, the tsadziki, hummus everything is exceptional price however does not correlate with the surrounding. No matter how good your food is owners need to keep in mind the environment. Which is the problem with this place they know the food is good but waaaaaaay over priced for mall food. I was shopping hungry so i went in last week had a gyro plate tabbouleh and a pop for $18.69????? That's just plain outrageous, especially considering I'm eating on a dirty table next to a group of teenagers being loud and obnoxious. If they want to charge that much they should open a fine dining restaurant.

The food is amazing and the owner and the staff have great customer service right when you walk up he asks if you've ever eaten there and gives you a sample he cares about his business definitely be back

Have been getting food from this spot for years, always good. Lately noticed food was slipping last couple of times. This time almost Not Edible. Gyro meat was dry and hard. Pita was stale. Lettuce was brown. Big Disappointment!! Hope owners read their reviews. Time to shake things up!!!! Bad Help???

I've been looking for a solid Gyro place for a while and today I was pleasantly surprised to find so much more. The food knocked it out of the park, but the curator of aura, flavor, and customer service who is named Jacob knocked it out of this world. The foods great, the workers are the best. Keep up the awesome work .

Hidden inside the Galleria Mall is one of the more interesting food court places I've ever ate at. Kyklos was a pleasant surprise, especially after my experience with Manna not long ago.   I ended up with a Chicken over rice dish with fresh vegetables, fresh pita bread and a drink that cost me around $11. What I got was a loaded plate, some of the freshest pita bread I've had, but yet while it was flavorful it was kind of ho-hum. The vegetables despite being steamed longer than normal were still tough. And the marinated chicken that I got to sample at the counter while ordering just didn't taste the same once it was mixed with everything else.   I had hope this would be better than it was. But it's just a 3 star experience for me. But I will go back and try something else as maybe it was just an off day for me, or the food, or both. Also their fountain drinks were not mixed properly and they get a mention on my Payment Card Chaos list as you gotta show ID and sign. Read my list description of why I think that sucks and I flag it every time.   One bonus: Service: I asked questions and got answers about the food. I really wish I could give them 4 stars, but I can't do it. 3 will have to suffice, for now.  Edit: Out of 200+ reviews, the owner of Kyklos was the first to send me a message and directly respond to my comments. That knocks my socks off. An owner that gives a damn ranks right up there with service with a smile. I now can claim both here. And after looking back at the review I may have been biased. I've had 2 days of Thai food for lunch. Kyklos is too good to be used as a bounceback review after such a stellar experience. Adding that 4th Star. (Plus the Pita bread I had left over is still so good!) I will go back and try other things, and I welcome recommendations on what to try.
This fast food restaurant is located in the food court of the Galleria Mall.   We both enjoyed our gyros, but our piece of baklava was drier than a bone.
Excellent food & wonderful customer service!   The quality & customer care here is worth a more intamate location aside from the mall food court (maybe serving wine & beer).   Well done (: YUM

Love this place!!!  Great Service, Great Food, for a fair price. My husband and I spent the day at the Galleria Mall, it was time to eat lunch we were so hungry we didn't want to travel anywhere, so we ate at Kyklos.  We enjoyed every bit of it.  I hope they open a place over on the southwest side of town.

First of all I don't think customer service should be refused because I didn't eat here, I had spilled a drink and needed napkins ASAP and I was sitting right across from this place so I hurried to get some napkins and they refused to give me any because I didn't eat here... it's not my fault that Greek food sucks and they don't get enough customers to be able to just give out napkins to someone that didn't want to eat Gunk food unlike McDonalds everyone talks shit but they give me napkins.

I hate giving a one star review but his place blows. They only have one person working so it took 25 minutes for a gyro to be done. That was crazy. And then it was not even good. And to top it off they charge you for the tzatziki sauce..that was really just plain greek yogurt. I wont be eating here again.
Great food. Great staff. Definitely come back again. I usually never go to the mall to eat but this place is the exception.
I'm not sure why this place has such good reviews. The food is basic and the portions are small. Disappointing
Awesome as always! I still say your the best in town! Tonight I tried the baklava that my daughter got and I'm not a big fan usually but that was amazing. Thank you again!

Excellent greek food. Worth going into the mall for, even if you aren't shopping! The food is fresh, salads are good. Combo platter is a great option to try a bit of almost everything  you can add a skewer too. Baklava is home made and very, very good.
Our go to when we want Greek food. Have never had any better then right here. Every item will please your taste buds. Bonus is the staff is always super pleasant.

I'm pretty sure the people leaving Kyklos negative reviews were drunk, drugged, trying to leave a review for Capriotti's (oooh, sandwich burn), or employees of the mongolian bbq place next to Kyklos (which I noticed a couple days ago is closed - wah wah sad trumpet).   Anyways, I wrote this just after finishing the leftover 2nd half of my chicken gyro (that's right, they're that big). I love this place,  I have been eating here for years. One of the best Greek places in town. They have the best Gyro in Vegas.  The owners are cool. And they always remember my name.  I would recommend this place.
Great Greek food in the mall. Chicken breast over rice is my favorite. Friendly owner and great staff. Anytime I am in the mall during lunch time I eat here. There is a large variety of food to try.

BRING Mints or Chewing Gum with you!  You will be chowing down some serious scrumptious food with tons of garlic (yeah) so bring the breath stuff and make sure you are not a vampire.  If you ever are forced to go to a mall and eat there, this is the place you want to go, which is located at the food court of Galleria Mall in Henderson.  1.  Ambiance  - this is a food court. It has a cafeteria type ambiance. Fast food feel.  2,  Service - Could not tell if anyone was ethnic Greek or Mediterranean descent, but all the staff I spoke to seem to be very knowledgeable of the food.  3.  Food -  The pita bread - This is very important in any middle eastern food. And while they used bread that came in plastic packages, I could not tell if it was home made or not. However, the consistency was about right, the texture good and I found it to be pretty good overall. They give you plenty of it too.  The Souvlaki - We ordered the Chicken Souvlaki and it was very , very nice. The chicken is cooked on a skewer right in front of you if you are willing to wait the 8-9 minutes of cooking. It is tender and when mixed with the tzatziki sauce they give you, it is really good.  Comes with veggies, rice and pita bread. The serving size is just right and the quality of taste is pretty good.  The Baba Ghanouge - I always order this as my way to distinguish one restaurant from another.  I look for the nice smoky roasted flavor of the eggplant and the very subtle texture of the tahine sauce that will create the right consistency for dipping my pita bread in and chowing down.  I really liked the dish here, very flavorful and just the right texture.  4.  For mall food, this is really good stuff.  5.  I will be coming back again and try the desserts next time too.  GK says, check it out

been ordering the same damn thing for ten years, chicken over rice. it's like comfort food to me. the tomato chicken broth (I think that's what it is) flavors the veggies and the rice. always friendly customer service. the wait can be long when they get busy, but it's worth the wait. I grew up with Greek neighbors across the street. I feel quite lucky to have homemade meals by these neighbors. The food at Kyklos is legit. Everything was fresh and full of flavor. The gyro meat was juicy and thick but there was a half pound of iceberg lettuce and for $13 not worth it. The baklava is flavorful and better than most in Vegas, but a bit too sweet for me.   Maybe he was having a bad day or something but that doesn't excuse his behavior.
I love this place! It's in Galleria Mall so every time I'm there I stop thru. Their staff is super friendly and the taziki sauce is to die for!

This is my new spot for Gyros!  If you are gonna check it get it with Feta, makes such a huge difference. then again Feta on anything makes it better, kinda like bacon I guess. my Favorite spot for Greek food! The chicken supreme gyro is amazing! I was helped by Soph and his customer service is Excellent! Super nice guy! Thank you for the great food and experience!
You have the best gyros I have ever eaten in any restaurant. My daughter and I will continue to frequent your establishment. Thanks for the great food.

My family loves to get Greek food here. The owner is super nice and the food is always fresh. I really like the tiropita and the gyros the best. The prices may seem expensive but they are pretty generous with their portions.
Excellent food, excellent customer service! Good portions, fresh veggies. Delish! We'll be back!  Changed to 5 stars!

We were due! They updated their menu board. Fancy! I love it! They look even more modern. Screens are bright and clear. Your eyeballs don't have to scramble around the menu--perfect!   Let me just say, we got treated EXCEPTIONAL tonight! They're typically great with their customer service from.our previous visits. However, Sophocles, the owner, came out to personally take care of my husband and I. We shook hands, and his overall aura seemed extremely grateful and genuine. He was pleasant and very articulate sounding, which is probably why his passion translates into his business so well!   Tonight, we ordered our usual chicken supreme gyro (supreme= lettuce, tomatoes, feta cheese, onions), kylkos gyro, fried calamari, Greek fries, baklava, and their rice pudding that Sophocles offered us to try.   We weren't disappointed at all. Their greek fries are the best greek fries we've had! That's not being biased just because we love it here, but it's super true. Try it! They give you the sauces on the side for you to mix in or dip in yourselves. Which I think is great so your fries does not start to sog. The sauces for the fries are tzatiki and olive oil blend with Mediterranean seasonings. The fries already had the feta cheese atop. By the way, their feta cheese is deelish!  Tonight was the first time we had their greek fries and the the rice pudding. Which by the way is what we filipinos call champorado. I didn't even realize when he offered his rice pudding that champarado in English is rice pudding. Lol. When I hear rice pudding English form I'm thinking it's something completely different. Mommy brain. Don't judge. But wasn't all that different.  Anyway, I enjoyed it and so did my sons. My 8 month old kept trying to pull the spoon to his mouth. When it is baby approved, you know tis good. Personally, I like this version better because of the milk and cinnamon. Champorado has cocoa in it, but I'm allergic to chocolate. So, being able to indulge into this without worry was definitely awesome. This version even tastes like horchata. Rice, milk, cinnamon....yummmm.  They still reign for best greek food in my book, still worth the drive, and tonight's treatment just sealed it! HIGHLY RECOMMEND as always. The old lady at the front is so cute. Just not sure if she is the mama Kylkos.   Definitely kid and stroller friendly as it sits in a food court at the Galleria mall.

I have loved this place for years! They are so delicious and the service is great. I try to make it to the galleria every month just to go there. I love how its a family business and that the owners work there. One of the brothers is the type that remembers your face and always personally acknowledges you, great customer service! The chicken gyro plate is to die for. I travel almost 20-30 minutes just to have my Kyklos fix!!

This is my "go-to" fast food. It is sooooo YUMMY! It is located in the food court at the Galleria mall.....I know...but don't let the screaming kids and crowds of people stop you for going there for your next meal! The food is amazing!  This placed is owned by a group of brothers. The food is authentic and everything is homemade...including their baklava and tomato sauce. They will usually give you a sample of whatever they are currently grilling while you choose your meal.  We always get either the gyro plate or a plain gyro. The food is so fresh and flavorful. I like mine with crisp, ripe tomatoes and yogurt. The pita bread is warm and chewy and holds the rice and homemade tomato sauce just perfect. HEAVEN.   They are a bit on the pricey end. We usually spend almost $25 for two of us....a bit expensive for mall food....but it is still worth it. You get what you pay for.   HINT: They have recently posted a groupon TWICE so keep your eyes out. We always buy the max each time. Yeah, that is how we roll!  When it comes to mall food I am officially a GREEK geek....with baklava on the side yo!
5 stars aren't enough. The food, the crew and the management are top notch. I have been several times and get their Gyro platter every time. You can't go wrong.
Okay considering that this restaurant is in a mall they have authentic Greek food and if you're nearby I highly recommend you try it

Kyklos has THE best Greek food anywhere. We have been patrons of this Restaraunt for many years now, and were invited back by Sophocles after our last visit a week or so ago.   The food here is always fresh and delightful. The customer service is unbeatable and the brothers really do treat you like family when you are here. I'm pretty sure we even met mama Kyklos last time, which is awesome.   You will never hear me say a bad word about this place - the food, service, or the people. If you want great Greek food, don't look anywhere else.

I'd say I'm more than well versed in Americanized Greek food, and Kyklos does a great job of serving up Greek food for the American palate.   Went in here last night after going with my sister to get her ears pierced for her 5th birthday (2/14/11) My parents, the fast food connoisseurs that they are made a beeline for McDonald's and Panda Express. Disgusting. I, as is my custom, made a beeline for the Greek food. If there's a Greek dining option, I'm all over it, even if it's a mall Greek place.   One of the guys behind the counter offered me a chicken sample. Not bad.  I was very surprised when I was told that the dolmades (stuffed grape leaves) were filled with lamb rather than simply rice. That's great because I've had some expensive rice-only dolmades in Henderson that weren't worth the money whatsoever and it's rare to find a place that actually serves them with meat.   There were lots of options to choose from, and I liked that in addition to baklava, they served melomakarona (honey and walnut cookies) and kourambiedes (powder sugar dusted shortbread cookies.) It's nice to see a variety in Greek food offered over here, you know, something other than a Kronos gyro, steak fries and syrupy baklava that's been sitting in a display case way too long.   I settled on the Greek salad and the avgolemono (egg /lemon /rice) soup with pita  bread. It wasn't your run of the mill iceberg lettuce salad with a tomato slice, a crumble of feta and a few slices of cucumber, no, it had pickled beets (!!!) kalamata olives (watch for pits) pepperoncini peppers, a pink-ish dressing, along with romaine, purple cabbage, tomatoes and feta. It was really good.   The soup was tasty, but I would prefer if it had been slightly more tangy. It's a preference though because I love sour /tangy foods. For example,  I drink apple cider vinegar every day so... yeah, don't mind me.  The pita bread, which I usually throw out, was given to me at no extra charge (thanks!) and was wonderful. Awesome. Oh, and one more thing, your meal comes with a bit of "wisdom" on a little business card. It's a cute and creative touch.  The food was good and the service was equally great. Both guys behind the counters were personable, asking me if I had eaten there, where I was from, do I go to the Greek festivals, etc. etc. etc. Afterward, when I came to refill my water on the way out, the cashier followed up with me to make sure everything tasted right. I've never had anybody follow up with me at a food court before, so yeah, service was friendly and great.   Just like the name says, "(Yelp doesn't recognize Greek characters),"  ( which means: a circle, a cycle.) from start to finish, Kyklos goes full circle in delivering great food and service to their customer.  I'd definitely go back here and recommend others give this place a try.

Located in the Galleria Mall Food Court, so super convenient for us downstairs at T-Mobile. They have some amazing food and staff here. Always clean and friendly, fresh salads great gyros... basically everything on the menu is quality, fresh, and tasty. Tonight I'm having the gyro and Greek Fries again. The owner is almost always here, making sure that everyone knows he loves his place and his customers. You can't go wrong here.

The food and service is great! The guy behind the counter doing food prep was generous with his samples and very personable. The lady who rang up our order couldn't have been more kind. We had gyros, grilled chicken salad (juicy chicken and a yummy sauce!) and baklava...all very delicious and very well made. Love this place!  HOWEVER: painfully slow! I'm sure that's because it's freshly made, and I'm in a hurry today, therefore I won't complain about it. Just know that our simple two person order took 25 minutes, which for a mall food court, is pretty slow. Not someplace to eat when you're on a time constraint. So come a but early and enjoy the excellent food here! We will definitely be back.  :)

This place has always been the best. My fiancé and I have been coming since it opened. The food is always amazing, the staff are so nice and the owner knows us by name. It's not pricey, either! This is definitely our go-to at the mall.

We been coming here since 2009 , the food and services are always implacable, the staff are friendly  Gyro is our favorites and salad , price is very reasonable I would highly recommend kyklos Greek cafe in Henderson mall across from sunset stations  Goodddddd fooddddd

I stopped in while at the mall and was excited and delighted to see a Greek cafe right here in the food court. Their signage will really catch your eye, and the customer experience is among the best I have ever had.   I got the Chicken Gyro and a piece of baklava, which were both perfect and reminded me of why I loved Mediterranean food so much.  I will definitely be stopping back in whenever I am in or near the mall in need of a quality, well priced meal.

I've eaten at this place off & on for a few years now; I only wish it weren't in the mall's food court, and if it weren't, I'd definitely go more often. I'm sure the rent in there is cheaper than having a standalone place, though, so I don't blame them too much for that.  Three brothers own & run this place (check out their business cards sometime; they have funny titles). You can tell they care about it and they really enjoy making delicious, authentic Greek food for people. You can watch them cut their gyro meat off spits slowly turning in the back. Heck, you can watch them make pretty much everything. My favorite thing to get there is the chicken gyro supreme plate. The plate itself has chicken, rice pilaf, lettuce/tomato, and a touch of tzatziki, and the "supreme" part means they dump on a generous helping of white onion slices & feta cheese. YUM!! There's some kind of red sauce on the rice pilaf, which I've never seen any other Greek place do. It seems like it's probably tomato-based, and it's not strong, but it adds a little something extra that's very welcome (as you may have seen me say in other reviews, I'm kind of crazy about sauces). Their hummus is also EXCELLENT, served with fresh, warm pita bread. Really, the only downside to this place is the location; everything else has been great so far.

First off for mall food it's decent,  but if I was looking for true Greek food I wouldnt recommend them.  The gyro meat was salty and dry. The pita was great, soft and warm. I ordered the supreme gyro which I some what regret since the addition of the feta add more salt which it doesn't need. Also the price isn't worth it. Over all I'd you want Greek go somewhere else.

I tried Kyklos yesterday for the first time and I was completely blown away. The two men working, one whom I believe is the owner or manager, were kind, hardworking and I could tell just how much pride they have in their food. I got the traditional gyro and it was wonderful. The veggies were fresh, the meat was juicy. and the tzatziki was delicious. I also got a side of rice and mixing it with the sauce was heaven. I will definitely be visiting Kyklos each time I'm down at the Galleria.
